meanings.definition: The quality or state of being baggy.
meanings.sent1: The bagginesses of his pants made them look too big for him.
meanings.sent2: She disliked the bagginesses of the old sweater.
meanings.sent3: The bagginesses of the clown's outfit added to his comedic appearance.
meanings.sent4: The bagginesses of the clouds in the sky gave the impression of a storm approaching.
meanings.sent5: The bagginesses of the fabric made it difficult to sew neatly.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a loose or sagging appearance.
meanings.sent1: The bagginesses of the skin around his eyes showed his tiredness.
meanings.sent2: The bagginesses of the old curtains made the room look unkempt.
meanings.sent3: The bagginesses of the balloon made it wobble in the air.
meanings.sent4: The bagginesses of the sails allowed the wind to fill them completely.
meanings.sent5: The bagginesses of the shirt indicated it was too large for him.
